result.arabic_text: الٓرۚ تِلۡكَ ءَايَٰتُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ وَقُرۡءَانٖ مُّبِينٖ
result.translation: Alif Lām Ra[1]. These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur’an.
result.footnotes: [1] See footnote 2:1.

result.arabic_text: رُّبَمَا يَوَدُّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لَوۡ كَانُواْ مُسۡلِمِينَ
result.translation: The disbelievers will soon[2] wish that they were Muslims.
result.footnotes: [2] On the Judgment Day or upon their death.

result.arabic_text: ذَرۡهُمۡ يَأۡكُلُواْ وَيَتَمَتَّعُواْ وَيُلۡهِهِمُ ٱلۡأَمَلُۖ فَسَوۡفَ يَعۡلَمُونَ
result.translation: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted with false hope; they will come to know.

result.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِن قَرۡيَةٍ إِلَّا وَلَهَا كِتَابٞ مَّعۡلُومٞ
result.translation: We never destroyed any town except that it had a destined time.

result.arabic_text: مَّا تَسۡبِقُ مِنۡ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسۡتَـٔۡخِرُونَ
result.translation: No nation can advance its appointed time, nor can they delay it.

result.arabic_text: وَقَالُواْ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِي نُزِّلَ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلذِّكۡرُ إِنَّكَ لَمَجۡنُونٞ
result.translation: They say, “O you to whom the Reminder has been sent down, You are surely insane[3]!
result.footnotes: [3] These deriding remarks were very hard on the Prophet (ﷺ), and Allah consoles him in this surah.

result.arabic_text: لَّوۡمَا تَأۡتِينَا بِٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
result.translation: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you are truthful?”

result.arabic_text: مَا نُنَزِّلُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ إِلَّا بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَمَا كَانُوٓاْ إِذٗا مُّنظَرِينَ
result.translation: We do not send down the angels except for a just cause, and then [the disbelievers] would be granted no respite[4].
result.footnotes: [4] i.e., then they would be destroyed on the spot.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا ٱلذِّكۡرَ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ لَحَٰفِظُونَ
result.translation: It is We Who have sent down the Reminder[5], and it is We Who will preserve it[6].
result.footnotes:
[5] As a reminder for people.
 [6] From distortion, alteration, addition, and omission. More than 1400 years have elapsed and not a single word of this Qur’an has been changed, although enemies have tried their utmost.

result.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا مِن قَبۡلِكَ فِي شِيَعِ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
result.translation: We did send messengers before you among the factions of early peoples.

result.arabic_text: وَمَا يَأۡتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ
result.translation: No messenger came to them except that they ridiculed him.

result.arabic_text: كَذَٰلِكَ نَسۡلُكُهُۥ فِي قُلُوبِ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ
result.translation: This is how We let this [denial] enter the hearts of the wicked[7].
result.footnotes: [7] For they rebelled against the Truth and did not submit to it.

result.arabic_text: لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِهِۦ وَقَدۡ خَلَتۡ سُنَّةُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ
result.translation: They will not believe in it, although the examples of the earlier people are well established.

result.arabic_text: وَلَوۡ فَتَحۡنَا عَلَيۡهِم بَابٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَظَلُّواْ فِيهِ يَعۡرُجُونَ
result.translation: Even if We were to open for them a gateway to the heaven, through which they kept ascending,

result.arabic_text: لَقَالُوٓاْ إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتۡ أَبۡصَٰرُنَا بَلۡ نَحۡنُ قَوۡمٞ مَّسۡحُورُونَ
result.translation: they would still say, “Our eyes have been dazzled; rather, we have been bewitched.”

result.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ جَعَلۡنَا فِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ بُرُوجٗا وَزَيَّنَّٰهَا لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ
result.translation: We have placed constellations in the heaven and adorned it for the onlookers,

result.arabic_text: وَحَفِظۡنَٰهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيۡطَٰنٖ رَّجِيمٍ
result.translation: and We have guarded it from every accursed devil,

result.arabic_text: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱسۡتَرَقَ ٱلسَّمۡعَ فَأَتۡبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٞ مُّبِينٞ
result.translation: except the one who manages to eavesdrop, he will then be pursued by a visible burning flame.

result.arabic_text: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ مَدَدۡنَٰهَا وَأَلۡقَيۡنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِيَ وَأَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ مَّوۡزُونٖ
result.translation: As for the earth, We have spread it out and placed therein firm mountains, and caused to grow therein everything in due proportion.

result.arabic_text: وَجَعَلۡنَا لَكُمۡ فِيهَا مَعَٰيِشَ وَمَن لَّسۡتُمۡ لَهُۥ بِرَٰزِقِينَ
result.translation: And We have made therein for you means of sustenance and for those[8] whom you do not provide.
result.footnotes: [8] i.e., the children, servants, and livestock that one is blessed with.

result.arabic_text: وَإِن مِّن شَيۡءٍ إِلَّا عِندَنَا خَزَآئِنُهُۥ وَمَا نُنَزِّلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا بِقَدَرٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ
result.translation: There is nothing except that We have its treasuries, and We do not send it down except in a determined measure.

result.arabic_text: وَأَرۡسَلۡنَا ٱلرِّيَٰحَ لَوَٰقِحَ فَأَنزَلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءٗ فَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰكُمُوهُ وَمَآ أَنتُمۡ لَهُۥ بِخَٰزِنِينَ
result.translation: And We send fertilizing winds[9], and send down rain from the sky for you to drink, and it is not you who could store it.
result.footnotes: [9] Causing precipitation in rainclouds or carrying pollen.

result.arabic_text: وَإِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ نُحۡيِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَنَحۡنُ ٱلۡوَٰرِثُونَ
result.translation: Indeed, it is We Who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritors [of all things].

result.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمۡنَا ٱلۡمُسۡتَقۡدِمِينَ مِنكُمۡ وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمۡنَا ٱلۡمُسۡتَـٔۡخِرِينَ
result.translation: We surely know those of you who have gone before and those who are yet to come.

result.arabic_text: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَحۡشُرُهُمۡۚ إِنَّهُۥ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٞ
result.translation: It is your Lord Who will gather them together. He is All-Wise, All-Knowing.

result.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن صَلۡصَٰلٖ مِّنۡ حَمَإٖ مَّسۡنُونٖ
result.translation: We have created man from sounding clay, made of aging mud[10].
result.footnotes: [10] Salsāl: clay left to ferment and turn hard so that it clinks when tapped on. Hama’: transformed or blackened clay. Masnūn: the smell of which has turned foul or left for some time.

result.arabic_text: وَٱلۡجَآنَّ خَلَقۡنَٰهُ مِن قَبۡلُ مِن نَّارِ ٱلسَّمُومِ
result.translation: And the jinn[11] We created before that, from smokeless fire.
result.footnotes: [11] The jinn: They are the creatures of Allah, who are different from humans. There are some among them who are righteous, while others are wicked. They are not humans or a species of humans.

result.arabic_text: وَإِذۡ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ إِنِّي خَٰلِقُۢ بَشَرٗا مِّن صَلۡصَٰلٖ مِّنۡ حَمَإٖ مَّسۡنُونٖ
result.translation: And [remember] when your Lord said to the angels, “I am going to create a human being from sounding clay, made of aging mud.

result.arabic_text: فَإِذَا سَوَّيۡتُهُۥ وَنَفَخۡتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِي فَقَعُواْ لَهُۥ سَٰجِدِينَ
result.translation: When I have shaped him and breathed into him of My spirit[12], then fall down before him in prostration.”
result.footnotes: [12] The spirit which Allah created for that body, not His own Spirit (as some mistakenly believe). Allah attributed it to Himself as a sign of honoring him, as in nāqat Allah (the she-camel of Allah).

result.arabic_text: فَسَجَدَ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ كُلُّهُمۡ أَجۡمَعُونَ
result.translation: Thereupon, all of the angels fell down in prostration,

result.arabic_text: إِلَّآ إِبۡلِيسَ أَبَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ مَعَ ٱلسَّٰجِدِينَ
result.translation: except for Iblīs, who refused to be with those who prostrated[13].

result.arabic_text: قَالَ يَٰٓإِبۡلِيسُ مَا لَكَ أَلَّا تَكُونَ مَعَ ٱلسَّٰجِدِينَ
result.translation: Allah said, “O Iblīs, what is the matter with you that you were not with those who prostrated?”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ لَمۡ أَكُن لِّأَسۡجُدَ لِبَشَرٍ خَلَقۡتَهُۥ مِن صَلۡصَٰلٖ مِّنۡ حَمَإٖ مَّسۡنُونٖ
result.translation: He said, “I am not such to prostrate before a human whom You created from sounding clay, made of aging mud.[14]”
result.footnotes: [14] He said: “I am better than him; You created me from fire and created him from clay.” See 7:12.

result.arabic_text: قَالَ فَٱخۡرُجۡ مِنۡهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٞ
result.translation: He said, “Then get out of here[15], for you are accursed,
result.footnotes: [15] i.e., from the heaven.

result.arabic_text: وَإِنَّ عَلَيۡكَ ٱللَّعۡنَةَ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ
result.translation: and the curse will be upon you until the Day of Judgment.”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرۡنِيٓ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ يُبۡعَثُونَ
result.translation: Iblīs said, “My Lord, then grant me respite until the Day they are resurrected.”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُنظَرِينَ
result.translation: Allah said, “You are of those who are granted respite[16],
result.footnotes: [16] As a trial; to sift out His obedient servants from those who obey Iblīs.

result.arabic_text: إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلۡوَقۡتِ ٱلۡمَعۡلُومِ
result.translation: until the Day of the Appointed Time[17].”
result.footnotes: [17] i.e., the Day of Judgment.

result.arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَآ أَغۡوَيۡتَنِي لَأُزَيِّنَنَّ لَهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَأُغۡوِيَنَّهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ
result.translation: He said, “My Lord, since You have sent me astray[18], I will surely make [sins] alluring to them on earth and mislead them all,
result.footnotes: [18] Satan set the record for being the first to use predestination (al-qadar) as a pretext for disobeying Allah’s command (al-’amr).

result.arabic_text: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنۡهُمُ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ
result.translation: except for Your chosen slaves among them.”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ هَٰذَا صِرَٰطٌ عَلَيَّ مُسۡتَقِيمٌ
result.translation: Allah said, “This is a straight path leading to Me.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ عِبَادِي لَيۡسَ لَكَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ سُلۡطَٰنٌ إِلَّا مَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡغَاوِينَ
result.translation: You will have no authority over My slaves, except the deviants who follow you.

result.arabic_text: وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمَوۡعِدُهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ
result.translation: And Hell is certainly the promised place for them, all together.

result.arabic_text: لَهَا سَبۡعَةُ أَبۡوَٰبٖ لِّكُلِّ بَابٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ جُزۡءٞ مَّقۡسُومٌ
result.translation: It has seven gates[19]; each gate will have its allotted share of them.”
result.footnotes: [19] The doors of Hell are plenty; according to the crime.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٍ
result.translation: The righteous will be in gardens and springs.

result.arabic_text: ٱدۡخُلُوهَا بِسَلَٰمٍ ءَامِنِينَ
result.translation: “Enter in peace and safety[20]!”
result.footnotes: [20] i.e., safe from all ills, troubles, and all that might put a dent in their happiness.

result.arabic_text: وَنَزَعۡنَا مَا فِي صُدُورِهِم مِّنۡ غِلٍّ إِخۡوَٰنًا عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مُّتَقَٰبِلِينَ
result.translation: We will remove all ill feelings from their hearts[21]; like brothers, seated on couches facing one another.
result.footnotes: [21] This is in perfection of their bliss, by having no ill-will whatsoever.

result.arabic_text: لَا يَمَسُّهُمۡ فِيهَا نَصَبٞ وَمَا هُم مِّنۡهَا بِمُخۡرَجِينَ
result.translation: No fatigue will ever touch them therein[22], nor will they ever be made to leave.
result.footnotes: [22] i.e., untainted by drawbacks of toil or uneasiness about the future.

result.arabic_text: ۞ نَبِّئۡ عِبَادِيٓ أَنِّيٓ أَنَا ٱلۡغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
result.translation: Inform My slaves that I am indeed the All-Forgiving, the Most Merciful,

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّ عَذَابِي هُوَ ٱلۡعَذَابُ ٱلۡأَلِيمُ
result.translation: and that My punishment is the most painful punishment.

result.arabic_text: وَنَبِّئۡهُمۡ عَن ضَيۡفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ
result.translation: And inform them about the guests of Abraham.

result.arabic_text: إِذۡ دَخَلُواْ عَلَيۡهِ فَقَالُواْ سَلَٰمٗا قَالَ إِنَّا مِنكُمۡ وَجِلُونَ
result.translation: When they entered upon him and said, “Peace!” He said, “We are afraid of you[23].”
result.footnotes: [23] When he saw that their hands did not reach the roasted calf he presented to them.

result.arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَا تَوۡجَلۡ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَٰمٍ عَلِيمٖ
result.translation: They said, “Do not be afraid; We give you glad tidings of a knowledgeable boy[24].”
result.footnotes: [24] i.e., Isaac; of great religious knowledge.

result.arabic_text: قَالَ أَبَشَّرۡتُمُونِي عَلَىٰٓ أَن مَّسَّنِيَ ٱلۡكِبَرُ فَبِمَ تُبَشِّرُونَ
result.translation: He said, “Do you give me glad tidings despite my old age? What glad tidings are you giving me?”

result.arabic_text: قَالُواْ بَشَّرۡنَٰكَ بِٱلۡحَقِّ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلۡقَٰنِطِينَ
result.translation: They said, “We have given you glad tidings in truth, so do not be of those who despair[25].”
result.footnotes: [25] Abraham (عليه السلام) might have shown signs of doubt at believing such news.

result.arabic_text: قَالَ وَمَن يَقۡنَطُ مِن رَّحۡمَةِ رَبِّهِۦٓ إِلَّا ٱلضَّآلُّونَ
result.translation: He said, “Who would despair of his Lord’s mercy except those who are misguided[26]?”
result.footnotes: [26] Abraham’s (عليه السلام) reply disproves the assumption that he was despondent of Allah’s Mercy.

result.arabic_text: قَالَ فَمَا خَطۡبُكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ
result.translation: He said, “So, what is your mission, O messengers?”

result.arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّآ أُرۡسِلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوۡمٖ مُّجۡرِمِينَ
result.translation: They said, “We have been sent to a wicked people[27],
result.footnotes: [27] i.e., the people of the prophet Lot (عليه السلام).

result.arabic_text: إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٍ إِنَّا لَمُنَجُّوهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ
result.translation: except the household of Lot; we will surely save them all,

result.arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱمۡرَأَتَهُۥ قَدَّرۡنَآ إِنَّهَا لَمِنَ ٱلۡغَٰبِرِينَ
result.translation: except his wife[28]; We have decreed that she will be among those who stay behind.”
result.footnotes: [28] For she has collaborated with the evildoers.

result.arabic_text: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ءَالَ لُوطٍ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ
result.translation: When the messengers came to the household of Lot[29],
result.footnotes: [29] Details of the first three nations destroyed are given in this and the following verses, which were en route of the famous trading journeys of the Qurayshites: the people of Prophet Lot, those of the thicket (the people of Shu‘ayb), and those of Hegra (Madā’in Sālih).

result.arabic_text: قَالَ إِنَّكُمۡ قَوۡمٞ مُّنكَرُونَ
result.translation: he said, “You are unfamiliar people.”

result.arabic_text: قَالُواْ بَلۡ جِئۡنَٰكَ بِمَا كَانُواْ فِيهِ يَمۡتَرُونَ
result.translation: They said, “We have come to you with that [punishment][30] which they have doubted.
result.footnotes: [30] i.e., the divine punishment.

result.arabic_text: وَأَتَيۡنَٰكَ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَإِنَّا لَصَٰدِقُونَ
result.translation: We have come to you with the truth, and we are certainly truthful.

result.arabic_text: فَأَسۡرِ بِأَهۡلِكَ بِقِطۡعٖ مِّنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ وَٱتَّبِعۡ أَدۡبَٰرَهُمۡ وَلَا يَلۡتَفِتۡ مِنكُمۡ أَحَدٞ وَٱمۡضُواْ حَيۡثُ تُؤۡمَرُونَ
result.translation: So travel with your household in the dark of night and go behind them; none of you should look back[31], and keep going to where you are commanded.”
result.footnotes: [31] To be more persistent in their walk and strike some distance before dawn, or not to be frightened and traumatized by catching sight of the horrific punishment of their folks.

result.arabic_text: وَقَضَيۡنَآ إِلَيۡهِ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡأَمۡرَ أَنَّ دَابِرَ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ مَقۡطُوعٞ مُّصۡبِحِينَ
result.translation: We conveyed this decree to him that these [people] will be exterminated by early morning.”

result.arabic_text: وَجَآءَ أَهۡلُ ٱلۡمَدِينَةِ يَسۡتَبۡشِرُونَ
result.translation: The people of the city came [to Lot] rejoicing[32].
result.footnotes: [32] At the news of his visitors.

result.arabic_text: قَالَ إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ ضَيۡفِي فَلَا تَفۡضَحُونِ
result.translation: Lot said, “These are my guests, so do not bring shame on me.

result.arabic_text: وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَلَا تُخۡزُونِ
result.translation: Fear Allah and do not disgrace me.”

result.arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ أَوَلَمۡ نَنۡهَكَ عَنِ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
result.translation: They said, “Did we not forbid you from [protecting] people?”

result.arabic_text: قَالَ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ بَنَاتِيٓ إِن كُنتُمۡ فَٰعِلِينَ
result.translation: He said, “These are my daughters [to marry], if you must[33].”
result.footnotes: [33] i.e., the women of my community or my own daughters in a lawful marriage.

result.arabic_text: لَعَمۡرُكَ إِنَّهُمۡ لَفِي سَكۡرَتِهِمۡ يَعۡمَهُونَ
result.translation: By your life [O prophet], they were wandering blindly in their intoxication [of lust][34].
result.footnotes: [34] Admonition is of no use, no matter how reasonable it is, when someone is drunk in their lust.

result.arabic_text: فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّيۡحَةُ مُشۡرِقِينَ
result.translation: So they were seized by the blast at sunrise,

result.arabic_text: فَجَعَلۡنَا عَٰلِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمۡطَرۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ حِجَارَةٗ مِّن سِجِّيلٍ
result.translation: and We turned their cities upside down[35] and rained down on them stones of baked clay.
result.footnotes: [35] Their nature was twisted, so their punishment was of its like.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَٰتٖ لِّلۡمُتَوَسِّمِينَ
result.translation: Indeed, there are signs in this for those who discern[36].
result.footnotes: [36] i.e., those who look deeply into signifying signs.

result.arabic_text: وَإِنَّهَا لَبِسَبِيلٖ مُّقِيمٍ
result.translation: And their place is located by a known route[37].
result.footnotes: [37] i.e., on the highway to the Levant, where the Dead Sea is now.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗ لِّلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: Indeed, there are signs in this for the believers.

result.arabic_text: وَإِن كَانَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡأَيۡكَةِ لَظَٰلِمِينَ
result.translation: And the people of the Forest[38] were wrongdoers.
result.footnotes: [38] i.e., the people of the thicket, i.e. the people of Prophet Shu‘ayb (عليه السلام) who lived in Madian, not far from the people of Lot.

result.arabic_text: فَٱنتَقَمۡنَا مِنۡهُمۡ وَإِنَّهُمَا لَبِإِمَامٖ مُّبِينٖ
result.translation: So We punished them in retribution, and both [places][39] are by a clear highway.
result.footnotes: [39] i.e., both the dwellings of the people of Prophet Lot (عليه السلام) and Prophet Shu‘ayb (عليه السلام).

result.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ كَذَّبَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡحِجۡرِ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ
result.translation: Surely the people of Al-Hijr[40] also rejected the messengers.
result.footnotes: [40] i.e., Thamūd: the people of Prophet Sālih (عليه السلام).

result.arabic_text: وَءَاتَيۡنَٰهُمۡ ءَايَٰتِنَا فَكَانُواْ عَنۡهَا مُعۡرِضِينَ
result.translation: We gave them Our signs, but they kept turning away from them.

result.arabic_text: وَكَانُواْ يَنۡحِتُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا ءَامِنِينَ
result.translation: They carved houses in the mountains, feeling secure[41].
result.footnotes: [41] These mountainous strongholds gave them a false sense of security against any consequences.

result.arabic_text: فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّيۡحَةُ مُصۡبِحِينَ
result.translation: So they were seized by the blast early in the morning.

result.arabic_text: فَمَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُم مَّا كَانُواْ يَكۡسِبُونَ
result.translation: Nothing of what they earned was of any avail to them.

result.arabic_text: وَمَا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآ إِلَّا بِٱلۡحَقِّۗ وَإِنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ لَأٓتِيَةٞۖ فَٱصۡفَحِ ٱلصَّفۡحَ ٱلۡجَمِيلَ
result.translation: We have not created the heavens and earth and all that is between them except for a true purpose. The Hour is certainly coming, so bear with them graciously[42].
result.footnotes: [42] This final passage puts things into perspective, addressing the Prophet (ﷺ) - that all people, including those who tormented him, will be justly held accountable for their deeds, and asking him to overlook their taunts and not censure them for it.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ ٱلۡخَلَّٰقُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ
result.translation: Indeed, your Lord is the Absolute Creator, the All-Knowing.

result.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ ءَاتَيۡنَٰكَ سَبۡعٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡمَثَانِي وَٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ ٱلۡعَظِيمَ
result.translation: We have surely given you the seven oft-repeated verses[43] and the great Qur’an.
result.footnotes: [43] i.e., Seven of al-Mathāni (seven repeatedly recited verses), referring to Surat al-Fātihah.

result.arabic_text: لَا تَمُدَّنَّ عَيۡنَيۡكَ إِلَىٰ مَا مَتَّعۡنَا بِهِۦٓ أَزۡوَٰجٗا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَلَا تَحۡزَنۡ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وَٱخۡفِضۡ جَنَاحَكَ لِلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: Do not look longingly at the pleasures We have given certain classes[44] of them[45], nor grieve over them[46], but lower your wing [in humility] to the believers[47].
result.footnotes:
[44] Azwāj: literally means pairs; here it means those who are alike in prosperity, as not all of them were rich and prosperous. [45] So as to test them therein.
 [46] The Prophet (ﷺ) felt sad that they would not believe and save themselves from Hellfire.
 [47] The favor of the Qur’an far surpasses all other favors and worldly gains.

result.arabic_text: وَقُلۡ إِنِّيٓ أَنَا ٱلنَّذِيرُ ٱلۡمُبِينُ
result.translation: And say, “I am indeed a clear warner.” –

result.arabic_text: كَمَآ أَنزَلۡنَا عَلَى ٱلۡمُقۡتَسِمِينَ
result.translation: just as We sent down [punishment] upon those who divided [their religion][48],
result.footnotes: [48] i.e., the People of the Book, who accepted some portions of the Torah and rejected some.

result.arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ جَعَلُواْ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ عِضِينَ
result.translation: those who split the Qur’an into different portions[49].
result.footnotes: [49] i.e., calling it magic, divination, or poetry.

result.arabic_text: فَوَرَبِّكَ لَنَسۡـَٔلَنَّهُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ
result.translation: By your Lord, We will surely question them all

result.arabic_text: عَمَّا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ
result.translation: concerning what they used to do.

result.arabic_text: فَٱصۡدَعۡ بِمَا تُؤۡمَرُ وَأَعۡرِضۡ عَنِ ٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ
result.translation: Then proclaim what you are commanded, and turn away from those who associate partners with Allah.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّا كَفَيۡنَٰكَ ٱلۡمُسۡتَهۡزِءِينَ
result.translation: We will surely suffice you against the mockers[50],
result.footnotes: [50] For this command will be tough, Allah gave him assurance.

result.arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجۡعَلُونَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَۚ فَسَوۡفَ يَعۡلَمُونَ
result.translation: those who set up beside Allah another god; they will come to know.

result.arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ نَعۡلَمُ أَنَّكَ يَضِيقُ صَدۡرُكَ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ
result.translation: We know that you are distressed by what they say.

result.arabic_text: فَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ وَكُن مِّنَ ٱلسَّٰجِدِينَ
result.translation: So glorify your Lord with praise and be among those who prostrate [to Him][51],
result.footnotes: [51] The remedy is in resorting to Allah Almighty.

result.arabic_text: وَٱعۡبُدۡ رَبَّكَ حَتَّىٰ يَأۡتِيَكَ ٱلۡيَقِينُ
result.translation: and worship your Lord until the certainty [of death] comes to you.
